newsitem.title: RUSSIA: LUKoil Permneft unit sees output slipping to 2005.
newsitem.headline: LUKoil Permneft unit sees output slipping to 2005.

text.p: Russian LUKoil subsidiary AO LUKoil-Permneft forecast on Wednesday that its crude oil output would slip steadily to 2005.

Permneft First Deputy General Director Nikolai Kobyakov said 1997 oil output would slip to 6.4 million tonnes from 6.7 million in 1996. he said the unit did not have the financing to maintain or raise output under current tax regimes.
Out of the production unit's 4,908 wells, 277 were idle, he said. The company's 1995 output was 8.5 million tonnes.
Its 1996 output slipped because it transferred some reserves to another LUKoil unit, LUKoil-Perm, in the second half of the year. LUKoil owns 38 percent of the Permneft unit.
